member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.MacMan.CAlarmHistory.GetAlarms(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the Alarm history data at the specified alarm indexes.
member.example:
This sample code shows how to use the GetAlarms() method.

member.param: From starting index. The 1-based index at which the information is obtained
To ending index. The 1-based index at which the information is obtained
member.returns: An array list of CAlarm object that represents the Alarm history data if there is one available.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: ALARM HISTORY - List of all alarms in history in the descending order of date

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CAxis.GetActualFeedrate(Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndexEnum)
member.summary: Gets actual feedrate given axis index
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetActualFeedrate.
Dim enAxisIndex As AxisIndexEnum = AxisIndexEnum.X_Axis Dim dblValue As Double dblValue= objAxis.GetActualFeedrate(enAxisIndex)
member.param: Axis index. Values of parameter come from the AxisIndexEnum enumeration.
member.returns: A System.Double that represents the actual feedrate

DataUnit.para: For linear axes: Default unit is in mm/min. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method.
For rotary axes: Default unit is in degree/min

member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current System.
member.Figure: AUTO OPERATION - ACTUAL POSITION - X/Y/B/C ... FEEDRATE

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CAxis.GetCommandFeedrate
member.summary: Gets command feedrate. The path feedrate value can be feedrate per rev or per min. The GetFeedrateType function can be used to determine the feedrate type
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetCommandFeedrate.
Dim strValue As String = "" Dim dblValue As Double Dim enFeedrateType As FeedrateTypeEnum dblValue= objAxis.GetCommandFeedrate() enFeedrateType = objAxis.GetFeedrateType() if ( enFeedrateType = FeedrateTypeEnum.PerRevolution ) then strValue = String.Format("Fr = {0}", dblValue) Else strValue = String.Format("Fm = {0}", dblValue) End If
member.returns: A System.Double that represents the command path feedrate
member.DataUnit: Default unit is in mm. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method. It can be in rev or min.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current System.
member.Figure: AUTO OPERATION - ACTUAL POSITION - Fm - Actual feedrate per minute/ Fr - Actual feedrate per revolution

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logException
member.summary: Level 1 – All exceptions will be logged by the system. (not settable). It is highly not recommended to have polling routines that produce exceptions for any purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logSet
member.summary: Level 2 – Level 1 + all write functions to the API (default value for all class instances)

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logGet
member.summary: Level 3 – Level 2 + all read functions. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logAll
member.summary: Level 4 – all logging events regardless of level. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.Alarm
member.summary: This lamp goes on when the machine malfunctions or an incorrect program is input. It also goes on in the event of a computer fault.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.Limit
member.summary: This lamp goes on when the X-axis or Z-axis reaches its variable limit position. With the two-saddle specification, it goes on if any of the XA-, ZA-, XB-, and ZBaxes reach their limit.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.SlideHold
member.summary: This lamp goes on when the [SLIDE HOLD] button is pressed in the automatic or MDI mode. With a two-saddle specification machine, if the machine is operating in the automatic mode with the single block function turned on, the lamp also goes on when the operations in one block have been completed at one saddle and the other saddle has entered the slide hold state.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.STM
member.summary: This lamp is lit while auxiliary function operations other than axis movements - such as spindle gear range change, tool change, and spindle rotation - are being executed. When an axis movement command and S, T, or M command are designated in the same block, the axis movement command is executed after the completion of the S, T, or M operation. If a spindle gear range command, spindle speed command, or tool number command is changed using the manual intervention function (called out by pressing the [MID AUTO MANUAL] key), the S.T.M. indicating lamp blinks.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.Run
member.summary: This RUN lamp is lit while the machine is actually operating in the automatic or MDI mode.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.ProgramStop
member.summary:
This lamp is lit during a program stop (M00) or optional stop (M01) in the automatic or MDI mode. It blinks during dwell (G04).
Notes: If a program is current executing and Slide Hold is activated then the RUN state is OFF

member.name: F:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.TurretSelection
member.summary: This lamp is lit during turret selection

member.name: T:Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.SubSystemEnum

summary.para: List of available sub systems to functions, if applicable.
By default, the sub system is NC-AL for every instance of classes if applicable.

member.remarks:
The machine data area is logically divided into different logical data areas that are based on the coordinate of spindle and turrets/wheel locations.
*****************************************************
Application Notes 1: The following subsystem should be never used for getting/setting distinctive logical data. It can be used for displaying purpose since these subsystems will return values based on current Panel selection or Program Command Selection on NC.
NC-RUN,NC-RUN-1, NC-PANEL, NC-PANEL-1
*****************************************************
Application Notes 2: To assure that you are always get/set the same logical data areas mentioned above you can always set the subsystem accordingly.
For example:
1/ Machine equipped with main spindle and A turret/Wheel:
NC-AL => Data area in the upper left corner as shown in figure
2/ Machine equipped with multiple spindles and single turret/wheel:
NC-AL => Data area in the upper left corner as shown in figure
NC-AR => Data area in the upper right corner as shown in figure
*****************************************************
Application Notes 3:
Not all machines support all subsystems.
It is necessary to specify the sub system to obtain different machine data if applicable.
For example:
Obtaining machine data related to First spindle and A turret/Wheel:
objToolsAL.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum::NC_AL)
objToolsAL.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex)
Obtaining machine data related to Second spindle and A turret/Wheel:
objToolsAR.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum::NC_AR)
objToolsAR.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex)
*****************************************************
Application Notes 4:
All exceptions generated by API and all set/add/cal functions will be logged. Therefore, the application must be designed to minimize
unnecessary log by utilizing Object-Oriented Programming practices or preventing perform set/add/cal functions in a loop.

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.Close
member.summary: Close the communication with NC
member.remarks: Any subsequent call for NC data will fail after calling this method

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetCurrentAlarmMessage
member.summary: Gets current alarm message
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetCurrentAlarmMessage method .
Dim strValue As String = "" strValue = objMachine.GetCurrentAlarmMessage()
member.returns: A System.String value. If there is no alarm in the system, alarm message will be empty string.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: Current Alarm Message

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetOperationMode
member.summary: Gets current machine operation mode
member.example:
This sample code shows how to use the GetOperationMode() method.
Dim objMachine As CMachine Dim enOperationMode As OperationModeEnum enOperationMode = objMachine.GetOperationMode()
member.returns: An Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.OperationModeEnum enumeration value that represents the NC operation modes

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetExecutionMode
member.summary:
Gets the machine execution mode. It is considered running if it is currently executing a block of code either in Auto or MDI mode.
Notes: If a program is current executing and Slide Hold is activated then the execution mode is still active or Running
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetExecutionMode method
Dim enValue As ExecutionModeEnum enValue = m_objMachine.GetExecutionMode()
member.returns: An Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.ExecutionModeEnum enum value.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetSingleBlockState
member.summary: Gets the single block state
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetSingleBlockState method .
Dim enValue As OnOffStateEnum enValue = m_objMachine.GetSingleBlockMode()
member.returns: An Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.OnOffStateEnum enum value. It is ON if Single Block LED is on. Otherwise, it is OFF.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: SINGLE BLOCK

member.summary: Gets current state of the specified NC status

This example shows how to call GetNCStatus method .

member.param: NC status. Values of parameter come from Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.BitsEnum enumeration.

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetCuttingTime
member.summary: Gets cutting time. The cutting time will be reset when a part program is first started.
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetCuttingTime method .
Dim strValue As String = "" strValue = m_objMachine.GetCuttingTime()
member.returns: A System.String value that represents the time in this format: HHH:MM:SS where HHH = hours, MM = minutes, and SS = seconds Example: 0: 4:32 = 4 minutes 32 seconds
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: AUTO OPERATION - ACTUAL POSITION - LOAD ON/OFF - CUTTING TIME

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetHourMeterCount(Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.HourMeterEnum)
member.summary: Gets hour meter count for the specified type
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetHourMeterCount() method
Dim intValue as Int32 Dim enValue as HourMeterEnum intValue = objMachine.GetHourMeterCount(enValue)
member.returns: A System.Int32 value that represents the hour meter count time
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current System.
member.DataUnit: Second
member.Figure: AUTO OPERATION - ACT POS (2/2) - NC OPR. MONITOR - HOUR METER - COUNT

remarks.para:
One of the following specifications must be met in order to function:
Specification Valid/Invalid
NC Monitor: NC spec code [19,2] Valid

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetOperationUnitSystemDisplay
member.summary: Gets the current setting of machine data unit.
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetOperationUnitSystemDisplay method .
Dim intDataUnit As Integer
intDataUnit = objMachine.GetOperationUnitSystemDisplay
member.returns:
A System.Int32 value.
Preset value Operation unit system
0 1mm
1 0.01mm
2 0.001mm
3 0.0001mm
4 1inch
5 0.0001inch
6 0.00001inch
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: PARAMETER - UNIT - OPTIONAL PARAMETER - LENGTH UNIT SYSTEM - Current setting of data unit: mm/inch

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CMachine.GetNCReset
member.summary: Gets NC reset state. The state of NC Reset is last for a short period of time (less than 500ms) when Reset button is pressed.
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetNCReset method .
Dim enValue As OnOffStateEnum enValue = m_objMachine.GetNCReset()
member.returns: An Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.OnOffStateEnum enum value. It is ON if NC Reset button is pressed. Otherwise, it is OFF.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Class provides functions to obtain general machine status. This is the main class that must be created first and the Init method must be called to initiate the communication with machine once NC is fully started.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CWheel.GetMaxWheels
member.summary: Get total wheels available in the system. Currently, the system can be configured to have up to 4 wheels.
member.example:
This example shows how to use GetMaxWheels method
Dim intValue As Integer Dim objWheel As New CWheel intValue = objWheel.GetMaxWheels()
member.returns: A System.Integer that represents total wheels available in the system.

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.MacMan.COperatingHistory.GetTodayOperatingHistory(System.Int32,System.Int32,Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.OperatingReportDataEnum)
member.summary: Gets today operating history at the specified report data, and report indexes
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetTodayOperatingHistory method
Dim objOperatingHistory As New COperatingHistory Dim strValues As New StringBuilder Dim intValues() As Integer Dim intIndex As Integer Dim intValue As Integer Dim enValue As OperatingReportDataEnum = OperatingReportDataEnum.RunningTime intValues = objOperatingHistory.GetTodayOperatingHistory(intFromIndex , intToIndex, enValue) intIndex = intFromIndex For Each intValue In intValues strValues.Append(String.Format("Index {0}: {1}" + vbCrLf, intIndex.ToString, intValue)) intIndex = intIndex + 1 Next
member.param: Starting operating history index. The 1-based index at which the report information is obtained
Ending operating history index. The 1-based index at which the report information is obtained
Operating history data to be retrieved
member.returns: A zero-based array of System.Int32 values that represents the operation history data for the given indexes.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.remarks:
If a request for a total of 144 operating histories, then each value in the array is equivalent to the time period as shown in the table below. A value of 1 indicates that operating state is ON otherwise it is OFF.
Index Time slot (hh:mm)
0 00:00
1 00:10
2 00:20
... ...
... ...
142 23:40
143 23:50
member.Figure: OPERATING HIS - DAILY(TODAY):2006/10/25

This example shows how to call GetBitIO method

param.name: enIO
param.para: I/O variable type. Values of parameter come from Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.IOTypeEnum enumeration.

param.name: intAddressIndex
param.para: Input address is starting from 0 to 511
Output address is starting from 512 to 1023

member.param: Bit number. Values of parameter come from Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.BitsEnum enumeration.
member.returns: An Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.OnOffStateEnum enumeration value. It is ON if Bit is high. Otherwise, it is OFF.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: I/O Monitor application

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CIO.GetWordIO(Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.IOTypeEnum,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets I/O WORD at the specified address index
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetWordIO method
Dim intValue As Integer Dim enIO As IOTypeEnum = IOTypeEnum.Input intValue= objIO.GetLongWordIO(enIO, intAddressIndex)

param.name: enIO
param.para: I/O variable type. Values of parameter come from Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.IOTypeEnum enumeration.

param.name: intAddressIndex
param.para: Input address is starting from 0 to 511
Output address is starting from 512 to 1023

member.returns: A System.Int32 value represents decimal value
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

remarks.para: Data value displayed on OSP IO Monitor application can have negative values in DEC column.
However, HEX column will display actual value.
For example:
If Word data of index 17 bit 15 is ON then it will be displayed as -1 in DEC column,
and FFFF in HEX column. This function will return 65535.

member.Figure: I/O Monitor application

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CIO.GetLongWordIO(Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.IOTypeEnum,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets I/O long word at the specified address index
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetLongWordIO method
Dim intValue As Int64 Dim enIO As IOTypeEnum = IOTypeEnum.Input intValue= objIO.GetLongWordIO(enIO, intAddressIndex)

param.name: enIO
param.para: I/O variable type. Values of parameter come from Okuma.CGDATAPI.Enumerations.IOTypeEnum enumeration.

param.name: intAddressIndex
param.para: Input address is starting from 0 to 510
Output address is starting from 512 to 1022

member.returns: A System.Int64 value represents decimal value
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

remarks.para: Data value displayed on OSP IO Monitor application can have negative values in DEC column. However, HEX column
will display actual value. For example: If Long Word data has a HEX value of FFFFFFFF then it will be displayed as -1
in DEC column. This function will return 4294967295 for the equivalent value of FFFFFFFF in HEX .

member.Figure: I/O Monitor application

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CIO.GetLabel(Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CIOAddress)
member.summary: Gets label associated with the I/O address location, I/O size, and I/O type.
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetLabel method
Dim objAddress As CIOAddress = new CIOAddress Dim strValue As String objAddress.Address = 11 objAddress.Bit = 15 objAddress.Size = IOAddressSizeEnum.Bit objAddress.IOType = IOTypeEnum.Input strValue = m_objIO.GetLabel(objAddress)
member.param: I/O address location, I/O address size, and I/O type
member.returns: A label if the label can be found based on the given information. It can be empty if no label assigned to an I/O address location
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: I/O Monitor application

remarks.para: **************** Important: This function can only support STA Threading model if Apartment state is required to be set ****************
Example:
remarks.code: Dim t As Threading.Thread t = New Threading.Thread(AddressOf GetIOThread) t.SetApartmentState(Threading.ApartmentState.STA) t.Start() .... Private Sub GetIOThread() Dim objIOAddress As CIOAddress Try objIOAddress = m_objIO.GetLabel(objIOAddress) Catch ex As Exception MsgBox(ex.ToString) End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CIO.GetIO(System.String)
member.summary: Gets I/O address value given I/O label.
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetLabel method
Dim objIOAddress As CIOAddress
txtPLCBitAddress.Text = "" txtPLCBit.Text = "" txtPLCBitData.Text = "" txtPLCWordData.Text = "" txtPLCWordAddress.Text = "" txtPLCLongWordAddress.Text = "" txtPLCLongWordData.Text = ""
objIOAddress = m_objIO.GetIO(txtIOLabel.Text)
cboIOVariableTypes.SelectedIndex = objIOAddress.IOType
Select Case objIOAddress.Size Case IOAddressSizeEnum.Bit txtPLCBitAddress.Text = objIOAddress.Address txtPLCBit.Text = objIOAddress.Bit txtPLCBitData.Text = objIOAddress.Value
Case IOAddressSizeEnum.Word txtPLCWordAddress.Text = objIOAddress.Address txtPLCWordData.Text = objIOAddress.Value
Case IOAddressSizeEnum.DWord txtPLCLongWordAddress.Text = objIOAddress.Address txtPLCLongWordData.Text = objIOAddress.Value
Case Else DisplayError("I/O Variables", "Not found") End Select
member.param: I/O address label for Bit/Word/Long Word. It is case-sensitive and cannot be blank label.
member.returns: An I/O address data value associated with the label if it is found. Otherwise, address/bit location will be reset to -1, and 0 respectively.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: I/O Monitor application

remarks.para: **************** Important: This function can only support STA Threading model if Apartment state is required to be set ****************
remarks.code: Example: Dim t As Threading.Thread t = New Threading.Thread(AddressOf GetIOThread) t.SetApartmentState(Threading.ApartmentState.STA) t.Start() .... Private Sub GetIOThread() Dim objIOAddress As CIOAddress Try objIOAddress = m_objIO.GetIO("ipNTS_B") Catch ex As Exception MsgBox(ex.ToString) End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Okuma.CGDATAPI.DataApi.CVariables.GetCommonVariableValues(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets common variables at the specified indexes
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetCommonVariableValues method
Dim strValues As New StringBuilder Dim dblValue As Double Dim arValues() As Double Dim intStartingIndex As Integer Dim intEndingIndex As Integer Dim intIndex As Integer arValues = m_objVariables.GetCommonVariableValues(intStartingIndex, intEndingIndex) intIndex = intStartingIndex For Each dblValue In arValues strValues.Append(String.Format("Index {0}: {1}" + vbCrLf, intIndex.ToString, dblValue)) intIndex = intIndex + 1 Next

returns.para: A zero-based array of System.Double value. Each array item will represent the common value for each common variable index
